reviewText: This tape was everything that I expected it to be. I have no complaint at all to make. It's VHS. The quality of the image was what I expected and the tape was in good condition. If "Doin' Time" had been available on DVD that's the format in which I would have preferred to buy it but it was only available on VHS and I'm glad to have found it.
This movie will never rank as one of the greats of cinema, but I found it a thoroughly enjoyable film in the "Police Acadeny" genre, told from the other side of the jailhouse door.
The movie is what I expected but as soon as I put it in the player, the machine ate it. It's a good thing they went to DVD and Blu Ray, but unfortunately, that title is unavailable on disc.
i purchased this for my friend he was excited when i gave him this movies so i think he going to try to play it so thank you so much

This movie is a laugh riot, Richard Mulligan is as silly as ever as Mongo.  John Vernon is also funny as the career criminal who wants to stay in jail.  Crazy antics, and crazy humor.  Where is the DVD?
